text:
166 Vector Calculus
Figure 5.13
Visualizing outer
products. Outer
products of vectors
increase the
dimensionality of
the array by 1 per
term. (a) The outer
product of two
vectors results in a
matrix; (b) the
outer product of
three vectors yields
a third-order tensor.
(a) Given a vector δ∈R4, we obtain the outer product δ2 := δ⊗δ= δδ⊤∈
R4×4 as a matrix.
(b) An outer product δ3 := δ⊗δ⊗δ ∈R4×4×4 results in a third-order tensor (“three-
dimensional matrix”), i.e., an array with three indexes.
